Engineering resources from Google

Dec 7, 2022

Engineering resources from Google

This is a collection of extremely useful internal resources, which are made publicly available. I thought I‚Äôd share these, since they are a bit hard to find externally. And, they really are fantastic - years and years of tweaks and discussions and refinement have gone into these, from some of the great minds of computer science.

So, enjoy, as I have:

The ‚ÄúSWE book‚Äù

https://abseil.io/resources/swe-book

The ‚ÄúSWE book‚Äù - Google Engineering Practices Documentation. A classic.

The ‚ÄúSRE book‚Äù

https://sre.google/sre-book/table-of-contents/

Another classic, more on the operation side of things.

How to code review

https://google.github.io/eng-practices/

The page is called ‚ÄúGoogle Engineering Practices Documentation‚Äù because the internal version is more broad, but the external version has the bits about how reviewers and reviewees of code changes should interact. These are fantastic guidelines for a healthy engineering culture.

The Go style guide

https://google.github.io/styleguide/go/

How to write ‚Äúgood‚Äù Go code at Google. Some of it is convention, but a lot of it is sensical and very well thought out rules of the road when writing Go code.

(I‚Äôm biased, having contributed some of these sections!)

Other language style guides

https://google.github.io/styleguide/

Well, I mostly care about Go, hence the callout, but here are the other language styleguide.

I‚Äôll also call out the C++ as being fantastic. I‚Äôve not used the others as much but I expect them all to be of a very high quality.
